alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 1:15PM PST until March 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of around 1 to 3 inches, with higher amounts at higher, remote elevations. * WHERE...Central Douglas County and Jackson County above 1500 feet. This includes Camas Mountain, areas near and south of Canyonville, Jacksonville, Ashland, Butte Falls, and Prospect. * WHEN...From 4 PM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
